There are contraindications to mifepristone and misoprostol (see table).

There are also contraindications to the medicated technique:

- coagulation disorders, anticoagulant treatment (no control of haemorrhage)

- profound anaemia (Hb < 9-10 g/dL)

- IUD in place

- patient isolated, did not understand the information, control visit impossible, travel after the procedure "in a risky health zone".

There are no absolute contraindications to the instrumental method.

question.title: What is a contraindication to the medicated technique of abortion?

option_a.title: Coagulation disorders
option_a.description: A condition where the blood is not able to clot properly

option_b.title: Severe asthma not controlled by treatment
option_b.description: A condition where the asthma is not manageable with medication

option_c.title: IUD in place
option_c.description: A condition where an intrauterine device is already present in the uterus

option_d.title: Patient isolated, did not understand the information
option_d.description: A condition where the patient is not aware of the procedure or its risks
